answerText: Isoleucine[10] Jasmonate accumulation in fruit may be related to the accumulation of this gaseous plant hormone, which is synthesized by the Yang cycle and is responsible for fruit ripening
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Brown University and Notre Dame | 1 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Eric Mukherjee wants you to know that jasmonates are a class of plant hormones that follow a similar synthesis pathway as mammalian prostaglandins and control disease and parasite response in plants. For ten points each: [10] Jasmonates typically conjugate with this amino acid, which contains ans isobutyl side chain and has symbol I. Its cyclized form is responsible for the phenotype of Maple Syrup Urine Disease.
